item.title: Disney+ 将连续第四年提高订阅价格
item.description: 迪斯尼公司周二表示，将于下月提高其旗舰产品 "迪斯尼+"流媒体服务在美国的价格，这家娱乐巨头正努力提高其数字平台的利润。【原文：Walt Disney said on Tuesday it will raise prices for its flagship Disney+ streaming service in the United States next month, as the entertainment giant pushes to bolster profits from its digital platforms.】

item.title: 加拿大央行行长：特朗普正在引发对美国货币政策独立性的质疑
item.description: 作者：Promit Mukherjee 和 David Ljunggren【原文：By Promit Mukherjee and David Ljunggren】

item.title: 首席执行官称 Exelon 将加大力度推动拥有大西洋中部电厂
item.description: 美国大型电力公司 Exelon 首席执行官卡尔文-巴特勒（Calvin Butler）本周告诉路透社，Exelon 计划明年在其大西洋中部服务区加大力度发展自己的发电厂。【原文：Major U.S. electric utility Exelon plans to step up its push to own power plants in its Mid-Atlantic service area next year, where electricity bills are spiking in the face of rising demand and new supplies are slow to be added, CEO Calvin Butler told Reuters this week.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，蒙特利尔银行考虑出售部分美国分行
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，蒙特利尔银行最近启动了出售其部分美国分行的程序，这些分行的存款额约为 60 亿美元。【原文：Bank of Montreal has recently launched a process to sell some of its U.S. branches with about $6 billion in deposits, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加拿大官员称，TikTok 将改进措施，让儿童远离应用程序
item.description: 加拿大隐私官员周二表示，加拿大的一项调查发现，TikTok 阻止儿童访问其网站和应用程序并保护个人信息的措施不够充分，因此 TikTok 已同意改进措施，不让儿童访问其网站和应用程序。【原文：TikTok has agreed to improve its measures to keep children off its website and app after a Canadian investigation found its steps to block children and protect personal information were inadequate, Canadian privacy officials said on Tuesday.】

item.title: VIEW 美联储鲍威尔重申就业和通胀风险不容乐观
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二表示，该央行正处于 "充满挑战的境地"，通胀速度超过预期的风险持续存在，与此同时，就业增长疲软也引发了人们对劳动力市场健康状况的担忧。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday the central bank is in a "challenging situation" with an ongoing risk of faster-than-expected inflation at the same time that weak job growth has raised concern about the health of the labor market.】

item.title: 美洲开发银行集团将 5000 亿美元的拉丁美洲贷款池作为全球投资目标
item.description: 美洲开发银行（Inter-American Development Bank）周二表示，该银行旨在通过帮助将高达 5000 亿美元的地区性地方贷款转变为可投资的全球资产，从而吸引私人资本进入拉丁美洲。【原文：The Inter-American Development Bank is aiming to attract private capital to Latin America by helping turn a pool of up to $500 billion of regional local loans into investable global assets, the lender said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 主要汽车制造商呼吁美国环保署放宽尾气排放规定
item.description: 代表几乎所有主要汽车制造商的一个团体周二要求特朗普政府撤销激进的汽车尾气排放限制，这些限制旨在迫使汽车行业生产越来越多的电动汽车。【原文：A group representing nearly all major automakers asked the Trump administration Tuesday to rollback aggressive vehicle emissions limits that seek to force the industry to build a rising number of electric vehicles.】

item.title: Meta 在 WhatsApp 上推出实时翻译功能
item.description: Meta Platforms 周二表示，将为其 WhatsApp 消息服务推出翻译功能，旨在方便其 30 多亿用户进行跨语言聊天。【原文：Meta Platforms on Tuesday said it is introducing a translation feature for its WhatsApp messaging service, aiming to ease cross‑language chats among its more than 3 billion users.】

item.title: 美联储主席鲍威尔：就业下行风险改变了风险平衡，促使上周降息
item.description: 这是一条突发新闻。全面报道将很快发布。【原文：This is a breaking news story. Full coverage will be available soon.】

item.title: ELFA 称 8 月份美国商业设备借款下降
item.description: 美国设备租赁与融资协会（ELFA）周二称，8月份美国公司的设备融资借款比去年同期减少了2%。【原文：U.S. companies borrowed 2% less to finance equipment in August than a year earlier, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association (ELFA) said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美联储博斯蒂克称美国经济仍存在通胀风险
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周二表示，美国经济仍存在通胀风险，不过他指出，到目前为止，唐纳德-特朗普总统的进口税上调政策并未像人们预期的那样推高物价。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said Tuesday inflation risks are still in play in the U.S. economy, although he noted that thus far President Donald Trump's import tax hikes have not pushed up prices the way they were expected to.】

item.title: 中国海康威视将挑战加拿大法院批准的停产令
item.description: 中国监控摄像机制造商海康威视周二表示，将对法院维持加拿大政府停止在加拿大运营的命令的裁决提出质疑。【原文：Chinese surveillance camera manufacturer Hikvision said on Tuesday it would challenge a court decision upholding a Canadian government order to cease operations in Canada.】

item.title: Nexstar 将继续抢先播出 "Jimmy Kimmel Live "节目
item.description: Nexstar Media Group 周二表示，尽管迪斯尼公司周一宣布将恢复播出《吉米-金梅尔现场秀》，但该公司计划通过播放其他节目，继续在其 ABC 附属公司上抢先播出该节目。【原文：Nexstar Media Group said Tuesday it plans to continue to preempt “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” on its ABC affiliates by running other programming, despite Disney's announcement on Monday that it will resume airing the show.】

item.title: 欧洲央行西波罗内预计 2029 年推出数字欧元
item.description: 欧洲央行董事会成员皮埃罗-西波隆（Piero Cipollone）周二表示，欧洲央行认为 2029 年是推出数字欧元的现实时间，数字欧元主要是由央行支持的在线支付钱包。【原文：The European Central Bank eyes 2029 as a realistic timeline for launching a digital euro, essentially an online payment wallet backed by the central bank, ECB board member Piero Cipollone said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，埃克森与俄罗斯石油公司签署初步协议，为挽回俄罗斯损失规划可能路径
item.description: 据两位熟悉谈判情况的消息人士透露，美国石油巨头埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil）和俄罗斯国营能源巨头俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft）已签署了一份不具约束力的初步协议，以帮助埃克森收回莫斯科入侵乌克兰后于 2022 年对其在俄罗斯的业务减记的 46 亿美元。【原文：U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil and Russian state-run energy giant Rosneft have signed a non-binding initial agreement to help Exxon recoup a $4.6 billion write-down it made on its activities in Russia in 2022 following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine, according to two sources familiar with the talks.】

item.title: 英国 Revolut 考虑收购美国银行，推动全球扩张
item.description: 英国 Revolut 公司周二表示，正在探索收购一家美国银行以加快全球扩张，并准备在本土市场推出消费信贷，这家数字金融公司正试图进一步蚕食传统贷款机构的地盘。【原文：Britain's Revolut said on Tuesday it was exploring buying a U.S. bank to accelerate global expansion and preparing to launch consumer credit in its home market, as the digital finance firm seeks to encroach further onto the turf of traditional lenders.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称德国经济机构将 2025 年经济增长预测上调至 0.2
item.description: 熟知内情的消息人士周二告诉路透社，德国五家主要经济机构将其对欧洲最大经济体 2025 年的经济增长预测上调至 0.2%，并预测明年和 2027 年的增长率分别为 1.3%和 1.4%。【原文：Five leading German economic institutes have nudged their 2025 growth forecast for Europe's largest economy up to 0.2% and predicted further rises of 1.3% next year and 1.4% in 2027, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利将通过与 Zerohash 的合作在 E*Trade 平台上提供加密货币交易服务
item.description: 摩根士丹利将通过与数字资产基础设施提供商 Zerohash 合作，从 2026 年上半年开始在其平台 E*Trade 上提供加密货币交易。【原文：Morgan Stanley will offer cryptocurrency trading on its platform E*Trade from the first half of 2026 through a partnership with Zerohash, an infrastructure provider for the digital assets.】

item.title: 印度电动汽车初创企业 Ultraviolette 对电池技术许可持开放态度，以增加收入来源
item.description: 电动两轮车初创企业 Ultraviolette Automotive 周二表示，该公司对其电池技术的授权持开放态度，因为这家由高通公司和 TVS Motor 支持的公司正寻求建立一个新的、利润率更高的收入来源。【原文：Electric two-wheeler startup Ultraviolette Automotive said on Tuesday it is open to licensing its battery technology, as the Qualcomm and TVS Motor‑backed company seeks to build a new, higher‑margin revenue stream.】

item.title: 美国 9 月商业活动进一步放缓
item.description: 9 月份，美国商业活动连续第二个月放缓，尽管企业抱怨关税提高了成本，但他们并没有提高商品和服务的价格，这对通胀前景来说是个好兆头。【原文：U.S. business activity slowed for a second straight month in September, and though firms complained about tariffs raising costs, they were not raising prices for their goods and services, which bodes well for the inflation outlook.】

item.title: 麦凯森上调年度利润预期，计划重点发展高利润业务
item.description: McKesson 周二上调了利润预期，这家美国药品分销商的目标是专注于癌症药物等高利润业务，以促进增长。【原文：McKesson on Tuesday raised its profit forecast, as the U.S. drug distributor aims to focus on high-margin businesses such as cancer medicines to boost growth.】

item.title: 由于人工智能的需求，巴西 WEG 将投资 7700 万美元提高美国工厂的产能
item.description: 巴西电机制造商 WEG 周二表示，将向美国一家特种变压器制造厂投资 7700 万美元，力图将该厂的产能提高 50%，因为人工智能将刺激巴西的需求。【原文：Brazilian motor maker WEG will invest $77 million in a U.S. specialty transformer manufacturing facility, it said on Tuesday, seeking to increase the plant's production capacity by 50% as artificial intelligence fuels demand in the country.】

item.title: 阿根廷市场在预期的特朗普-米莱会晤前延续强劲反弹势头
item.description: 周二，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普与阿根廷领导人哈维尔-米莱举行会晤之前，阿根廷国际债券跳涨，股市攀升，延续了上一交易日的大幅涨势。【原文：Argentina's international bonds jumped and stocks climbed on Tuesday ahead of an expected meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Argentine leader Javier Milei, extending the previous session's sharp gains.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比在 CNBC 节目中表示美联储有降息空间
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周二表示，如果通胀降温，央行有一定空间下调利率目标。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said Tuesday if inflation cools off the central bank has some space to cut its interest rate target.】

item.title: 券商称迪士尼应关闭 ABC 并将内容转移到流媒体领域
item.description: 券商Needham周二在一份客户报告中写道，华特迪士尼应该关闭ABC电视网，而不是将其出售，并将该频道的内容转移到其流媒体平台上，以降低监管风险并获得更高的估值。【原文：Walt Disney should shut down the ABC network rather than sell it and transfer the channel's content to its streaming platforms to lower regulatory risks and unlock higher valuation, brokerage Needham wrote in a client note on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普政府提出新的 H-1B 签证程序，倾向于高技能、高收入的工人
item.description: 根据一份相关的联邦登记公告，特朗普政府周二发布了一项提案，将重新制定 H-1B 签证的选择程序，以向高技能、高收入的工人倾斜，此举是继白宫周五宣布对该签证征收 10 万美元费用之后的又一举措。【原文：The Trump administration on Tuesday released a proposal that would rework the H-1B visa selection process to favor higher-skilled and better-paid workers, according to a related Federal Register notice, a move that follows a White House proclamation on Friday introducing a $100,000 fee for the visas.】

item.title: 高管称 Revolut 考虑收购美国银行以推进全球扩张
item.description: 英国 Revolut 公司周二表示，该公司正在探索收购一家美国银行，以加速全球扩张，并有意在本土市场推出信用卡，这家数字金融公司正试图进一步蚕食传统贷款机构的地盘。【原文：Britain's Revolut said on Tuesday it was exploring buying a U.S. bank to accelerate its global expansion and was eyeing launching credit cards in its home market, as the digital finance firm seeks to encroach further onto the turf of traditional lenders.】

item.title: 美国第二季度经常账户大幅收窄
item.description: 随着大量进口的减少，美国第二季度经常账户赤字的缩减幅度创下历史之最。【原文：The U.S. current account deficit contracted by the most on record in the second quarter as a flood of imports subsided.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼美联储需要果断抵御就业市场风险
item.description: 美联储负责监管事务的副主席米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）周二表示，美联储在支持劳动力市场方面可能会迟到，如果需求状况减弱，企业开始裁员，美联储可能需要加快降息步伐。【原文：The Federal Reserve may be late in supporting the labor market and could need to speed the pace of rate cuts if demand conditions weaken and businesses begin to lay off workers, Fed Vice Chair for Supervision Michelle Bowman said on Tuesday.】
